section:
Character Creation
Follow these steps to create a character sec:character_creation
Choose an archetype.
Print out a character sheet for your archetype. This will save you a lot of work during the game and is highly recommended.
Choose a name for the character.
Write your name in the players name area on the character sheet.
Fill in your height, weight, and age as specified by the archetype. Choose whatever gender you like.
Determine your Primary Attributes using one of the following two methods:
Random For each attribute, roll 2d4 + 4, and assign the sum of the dice to the attribute. After all attributes have been assigned, optionally swap one or two pairs of attribute values.
Fixed Choose one of the following sets of numbers and assign them to the primary attributes of your choice:
12, 11, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6 or
12, 11, 9, 9, 9, 7, 6
Fill in your opposed check modifiers. The opposed check modifier for an attribute is the value of the attribute minus nine, Dourli has a Strength of 12 and an Agility of 7. His opposed strength check modifier is +3 and his opposed agility check modifier is -2.
Determine your Initiative Score and Modifier:
Initiative Score = Archetype Initiative + Speed Attribute Initiative Bonus
N.B. Here the archetype initiative comes from the archetype document. It is different for each archetype. The attribute bonus comes from the Attribute Bonus Table, on page table:{{ doc_name }}_attribute_bonuses. The same basic approach is used when calculating the rest of the character statistics that follow; add a value from the archetype document to a bonus from the attribute bonus table.
Determine your Movement. sec:character_movement
Moves = Archetype Movement + Speed Attribute Move Bonus
Determine your Stamina.
Stamina = Archetype Stamina + Endurance Attribute Bonus for Stamina
Determine your characters Health.
Health = Archetype Health + Strength Attribute Bonus for Health
Determine your Resolve Dice Pool, Refresh Rate and Current Pool:
Resolve = Archetype Resolve Dice + Willpower Attribute Bonus Dice for Resolve
Fill in your Magic Pool and Magic Refresh Rate as described by your archetypes level progression table.
Magic = Archetype Magic Dice + Willpower Attribute Bonus Dice for Magic
The current pool starts equal to your Magic Pool. Not all characters are able to cast spells, but all characters have a magic pool. This pool represents their animus, their spark of life, and can be use to resist spells.
Determine your Fate Refresh Rate and Max Fate Pool from your archetype with bonuses for Luck from the Attibute Bonus Table, see Table table:{{ doc_name }}_attribute_bonuses on page table:{{ doc_name }}_attribute_bonuses. Set your Fate Pool to your Max Fate Pool value.
The rate of character progression is determined by Experience Points (XP). Starting XP is zero unless the GM states otherwise. The XP required to reach the next level is recorded in the archetype description document.
Determine the Skill Points you have available from your archetype level progression table and record them on your character sheet.
Players should choose a few initial aspects for their character. Newly acquired aspects have a difficulty of d4 + 4 unless the archetype description or the GM says otherwise. It is best to do this in a group with the other players and the GM. Better still let the other players choose an aspect for you.
During the course of the game new aspects can be added and old aspects removed, so the initial choice is not overly important. We suggest you choose one aspect that describe your characters politics, motivations or troubles and another one that describes your characters relationship with some other member in the party.
To provide inspiration, each archetype has some suggested aspects listed in their archetype document. There is also a table of random aspects in Section table:{{ doc_name }}_random_aspects on page table:{{ doc_name }}_random_aspects. You do not have to choose aspects from these lists. You are more than welcome to create your own. In fact it is preferable. Just make sure to run your aspects past your GM before committing them to paper, as GMs and players may need to collaborate to ensure that their character's aspects and the world, interact in interesting ways and are cogent.
Optionally sketch out a couple of lines of back story with your fellow players and GM with a few points about the characters history. For example, Dourli might come from the Iron Mountains and be searching for his long lost cousin Grimli.
Buy your starting skills using the skill point price list for your archetype. The price of each skill may vary from one archetype to the next.
Determine your starting money as described by your archetype.
Buy equipment. Note that each archetype also has a list of default starting equipment that you get for free at the start of the game.
Determine your Armour Class:
Armour Class = Archetype Armour Class + Shield Armour Class Bonus + Speed Armour Class Bonus
The shield bonus is available when equipping shields and a few other weapons that can be used defensively.
